 Working With Data 
 
 
 
 
 Data Services 
 
   
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Working with Data
                                 
 
 
 
   
 UCR and the library provides access to several software applications to manipulate, analyze, and visualize data, including Microsoft Excel and R.  SPSS is installed on the computers in the UCR Computer Labs.   
 Research methods in various disciplines will provide theory and practical information for conducting research in each field.  Search the Library Catalog using keywords such as   [discipline] Re search Methods  to find books supporting each field or discipline. 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 Working With Data Reference Shelf
                                 
 
 
 
 
 Good Enough Practices in Scientific Computing (Article) 
 A concise article that describes "computing tools and techniques that every researcher can and should consider adopting." If you have time to only read one article on Data Management, this should be it. 
 
 
 Best Practices in Scientific Computing (Article)

 Tools and Tutorials
                                 
 
 
 
 R Tutorials and Guides 
 
 
 Programming with R 
 A good tutorial covering the basics of R, and the objects R uses.  Exercises are included to test learning in each section. 
 
 
 UCR's Dr. Thomas Girke's Programming in R Guide 
 R programming guide written in a way even those with no programming experience should understand.  Includes commands, syntax, basic control structures, and sample scripts. 
 
 
 UCLA's R Resources and Tutorials 
 
 
 
 
 
   
 SPSS

 Excel For Statistical Data Analysis       
 
 
 
 
 
   
 Regular Expressions and Other Tools 
 
 
 knb's Morpho       
 
 
 
 Regular Expressions 
 Includes interactive panel to test RegEx expressions, cheatsheets, and reference guides. 
 
 
 Library Carpentry: Introduction to Working with Data (Regular Expressions) 
 Library Carpentry's curriculum describing regular expressions, with examples of how to use them.  Includes exercises with answers. 
 
 
 Microsoft's RegEx Quick Reference 
 Quick reference for RegEx character escapes, classes, substitutions, etc.
